intro: Derris diadelpha, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological features. Derris diadelpha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices.
